headline: Herschel Walker Endorsed by Pro-Life Organization
author: Angela Johnson
sentences: In a statement, National Right to Life President Carol Tobias expressed confidence that the Heisman Trophy winner will be the best person to represent pro-life interests in Congress.
In her statement, Tobias noted that Walker opposes the Womens Health Protection Act, a bill which legally protects a persons right to access abortion care throughout the country.
But despite skipping out on debates, lying about his education and a series of WTF interview moments, somehow this dude is still managing to poll ahead of his opponents.
Herschel is tough on Crime and Borders, and he will always stand in support of Law Enforcement, Military, and our Vets, Trump said in a statement.
Somehow former football player and Republican Georgia Senate candidate Herschel Walker is still convincing folks that hes the man for the job.

The Trump Effect
Walkers baffling popularity may have something to do with the endorsement he received from former President Donald Trump.
Walkers stance for life stands in stark contrast to the out-of-touch record of Warnock who supports abortion for any reason until birth.
Georgia deserves a pro-life senator like Herschel Walker who is committed to building a culture of life, said Tobias.
Herschel Walker is a friend, a Patriot, and an outstanding American who is going to be a GREAT United States Senator.

Leading the Pack
Here at The Root, we told white people that Walker is one of the Republicans they can keep.
Warnock, Georgias first Black senator, is running to keep his seat after winning a special election in 2020.
On April 19, Walker received an endorsement from anti-abortion organization National Right to Life.
A recent Emerson College poll showed Walker with 57 percent of the vote in the Republican primary.
National Right to Life is pleased to endorse Herschel Walker for the U.S. Senate, she said.
If he wins the Republican primary, Walker will face the incumbent, Democratic Senator Rev.
The same Emerson poll shows Walker with a slight 49 to 45 percent edge over Rev.
He embodies America First and the winning spirit of Georgia.
Gary Black is in a distant second place with 13 percent.
Sen. Warnock was a co-sponsor of the bill.
Raphael Warnock.
Warnock.
